Key Match Events: The Rockets lost to the Hornets 110-105 in their season opener.
The Rockets allowed Charlotte to outrebound them 56 to 43.
The Rockets surrendered 61 second-half points, 15 3s, and 42 points in the paint.
Houston registered a pace of 96.0 possessions per 48 minutes against the Hornets.
The Rockets scored just 13 fast-break points, three of which came after the intermission.
Fred VanVleet missed 14 of his 18 shots.
Amen Thompson finished the game with 13 points and four rebounds on 5-for-11 shooting in just 22 minutes off the bench.
Pre-Game Insights: Head coach Ime Udoka emphasized the importance of increasing the team's pace and playing to their strengths.
Udoka mentioned that the shift to a faster pace would be gradual and require constant reminders.
Post-Match Reflections: Ime Udoka expressed concern about the lack of running and poor performance in transition and offensive rebounding.
Jalen Green acknowledged that the team could have been better in transition and noted that it would be a season-long process.
